quotes.quote: The universe is always speaking to us... sending us little messages, causing coincidences and serendipities, reminding us to stop, to look around, to believe in something else, something more.
The manner of your speaking is full as important as the matter, as more people have ears to be tickled than understandings to judge.
A good portion of speaking will consist in knowing how to lie.
When in doubt, just spit it out. That all challenges can be overcome by speaking the truth, no matter how it comes out.
Prayer is you speaking to God. Meditation is allowing the spirit to speak to you.
Let's acknowledge the difference between speaking up with intention and speaking up for attention.
Speaking truth will rarely earn you friends, but it will reveal who your true friends are and who are true friends of Christ.
Speaking kind words starts a wave of love in motion that brings more love upon your shores.
A man speaking sense to himself is no madder than a man speaking nonsense not to himself.
We rarely repent of speaking little, but often of speaking too much.
Speaking is what most people work on. They forget the thinking and the breathing and instead try to occupy space with sound.
In speaking, it is best to be clear and say just enough to convey the meaning.
A talent for speaking differently, rather than for arguing well is the chief instrument of cultural change.
Everything in life is speaking in spite of its apparent silence.
Nothing in this world is harder than speaking the truth, nothing easier than flattery.
Broadly speaking, the short words are the best, and the old words best of all.
Public speaking is the art of diluting a two-minute idea with a two-hour vocabulary.
Man does not speak because he thinks; he thinks because he speaks. Or rather, speaking is no different than thinking: to speak is to think.
If you make yourself understood, you're always speaking well.
Silence is ever speaking; it is the perennial flow of language.
One must turn the tongue seven times in the mouth before speaking.
The act of speaking our intentions aloud shifts them from wishful thinking into action.
Use words to please, to instruct, to soothe. Then stop speaking.
Speaking with passion born of your own authentic experience and belief is always persuasive.
Good public speaking is based on good private thinking.
If you re not speaking your own truth, you will never be able to be all you are meant to be. You cannot be pretending to be somebody else.
Only one thing is more frightening than speaking your truth, and that is not speaking.
One open way of speaking introduces another open way of speaking, and draws out discoveries, like wine and love.
Speaking the truth, once you have started it, is too exhilarating to draw back.
The most powerful speaking you can do is the speaking that comes from your heart and your love.
